name: http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/WirelessAP3
desc: This service provides access to properties and settings of the 802.11 wireless access point with band steering feature.

GetRadioInfo2.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/GetRadioInfo2
GetRadioInfo2.desc: This action gets information and settings for the band steering and all of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

bandSteeringMode.desc: The band steering mode. This value exists if and only if isBandSteeringEnabled is true.

radios.desc: The list of information and settings for each radio.

SetRadioSettings2.name: http://linksys.com/jnap/wirelessap/SetRadioSettings2
SetRadioSettings2.desc: This action sets information and settings for band steering and one or more of the wireless access point's wireless radios.

bandSteeringMode.desc: The band steering mode. This is required when isBandSteeringEnabled is set to true.

radios.desc: The list of settings that should be set. Radios that are not included in this list will not have their settings changed unless they share a physical radio with one of the specified radios.

errors.ErrorBandSteeringNotSupported: Band steering is not supported on this platform.
errors.ErrorGuestSSIDConflict: One of the specified SSIDs is conflicting with another SSID on the guest network that is currently enabled.
errors.ErrorInvalidBandSteeringMode: Band steering mode specified is not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidBandSteeringRadioSettings: Band steering is enabled but the radio settings specified do not match.
errors.ErrorInvalidKey: One of the specified WEP keys was not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidPassphrase: One of the specified WPA passphrases was not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidRADIUSPort: One of the specified RADIUS port values was not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidRADIUSServer: One of the specified RADIUS servers was not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidSSID: One of the specified SSIDs was not between 1 and 32 bytes long.
errors.ErrorInvalidSharedKey: One of the specified WPA-Enterprise shared keys was not valid.
errors.ErrorInvalidTXKey: One of the specified WEP TX key values was not between 1 and 4.
errors.ErrorMissingBandSteeringMode: Band steering mode is not specified.
errors.ErrorMissingWEPSettings: One of the specified wireless security types was WEP, but no WEP settings were specified for that radio.
errors.ErrorMissingWPAEnterpriseSettings: One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Enterprise variant, but the no WPA-Enterprise settings were specified for that radio.
errors.ErrorMissingWPAPersonalSettings: One of the specified wireless security types was a WPA-Personal variant, but no WPA-Personal settings were specified for that radio.
errors.ErrorSuperfluousBandSteeringMode: Band steering mode was specified even though band steering is disabled.
errors.ErrorUnknownRadio: One of the specified radio IDs does not correspond to an actual radio in the access point.
errors.ErrorUnsupportedChannel: One of the specified wireless channels is not supported by that radio.
errors.ErrorUnsupportedChannelWidth: One of specified channel widths is not supported for the current wireless configuration. For example, specifying a channel width "Wide" is not supported with a wireless mode of "802.11a".
errors.ErrorUnsupportedMode: One of the specified radios does not support the wireless mode that was specified for it.
errors.ErrorUnsupportedSecurity: One of the specified radios does not support the wireless security type that was specified for it.

radioID.desc: The unique identifier of the radio. This value never changes for a particular radio, and no two radios is the same wireless access point will have the same radio ID.

physicalRadioID.desc: The unique identifier of the physical radio hardware. This value never changes for a particular radio. However, multiple radios within the wireless access point may have the same physical radio ID if the access point has a selectable-band radio. In this case, radios that have the same physical radio ID represent mutually-exclusive configurations of the same physical radio, and modifying settings of one radio will cause the settings of the other radio to be modified as well. Only one of the radios that share a physical radio can be enabled at any given time; enabling such a radio will cause the other radios to be disabled.

supportedModes.desc: The list of wireless modes that the radio supports.

supportedChannels.desc: The list of standard (20 MHz) wireless channels that the radio supports The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports channel auto-selection. Note that the list of supported channels depends on the access point's configured locale, since certain channels are only supported in certain regions.

supportedWideChannels.desc: The list of wide (40 MHz) wireless channels that the radio supports The presence of the value 0 in this list indicates that the radio supports wide channel auto-selection. This list may be empty if the radio does not support wide channels. Note that the list of supported wide channels depends on the access point's configured locale, since certain wide channels are only supported in certain regions.

supportedSecurityTypes.desc: The list of wireless security types that the radio supports.

maxRADIUSSharedKeyLength.desc: The maximum allowed length, in bytes, of a RADIUS shared key value.

passphrase.desc: The WPA passphrase. This value must either be a 8-63 characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) or exactly 64 ASCII hexadecimal digits.

ssid.desc: The radio's SSID. The maximum length of this value is 32 bytes.

channelWidth.desc: The wireless channel width that the radio operates on. Note that "Wide" is not allowed when mode is set to "802.11a". 802.11a does not support wide channels.

channel.desc: The wireless channel the radio should operate on. The value 0 indicates that the wireless access point should auto-select the channel.

wepSettings.desc: The radio's WEP settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is WEP. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is WEP; if the security is not WEP, this value is ignored if present.

wpaPersonalSettings.desc: The radio's WPA-Personal settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is a WPA-Personal variant. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is a WPA-Personal variant; if the security is not a WPA-Personal variant, this value is ignored if present.

wpaEnterpriseSettings.desc: The radio's WPA-Enterprise settings. When getting wireless radio settings, this value will be present if and only if the value of the security member is a WPA-Enterprise variant. When setting wireless radio settings, this value is required if the value of the security member is a WPA-Enterprise variant; if the security is not a WPA-Enterprise variant, this value is ignored if present.

radioID.desc: The unique identifier of the radio.

key1.desc: The first WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.

key2.desc: The second WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.

key3.desc: The third WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.

key4.desc: The fourth WEP key value. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-64, this value must be exactly 10 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. If the value of the encryption member is WEP-128, this value must be exactly 26 hexadecimal digits or an empty string. Specifying the empty string will clear the key if it was previously set.

txKey.desc: The index specifying which key value to use for encryption. The value of the corresponding key cannot be an empty string. This value must be between 1 and 4.

radiusServer.desc:
The IP address of the RADIUS server.
          
          The following restrictions from RFC 5735 are applied to the RADIUS server address.
          Address Block
              Description
              Reference
            0.0.0.0/8
              "This" Network
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            127.0.0.0/8
              Loopback
              RFC 1122, Section 3.2.1.3
            169.254.0.0/16
              Link Local
              RFC 3927
            224.0.0.0/4
              Multicast
              RFC 3171
            240.0.0.0/4
              Reserved for Future Use
              RFC 1112, Section 4
            255.255.255.255/32
              Limited Broadcast
              RFC 919, Section 7  RFC 922, Section 7

radiusPort.desc: The port number of the RADIUS server.

sharedKey.desc: The RADIUS shared secret. This value must be composed entirely of characters in the range U+0032 - U+007E (printable ASCII) and cannot be an empty string.

WirelessMode.802.11an: The radio only accepts 802.11a and 802.11n traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11bg: The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11g traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11bn: The radio only accepts 802.11b and 802.11n traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11gn: The radio only accepts 802.11g and 802.11n traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11anac: The radio only accepts 802.11a, 802.11n, and 802.11ac traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11bgn: The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11bgnac: The radio only accepts 802.11b, 802.11g, and 802.11n, 802.11ac traffic.
WirelessMode.802.11mixed: The radio accepts mixed mode traffic.

WirelessChannelWidth.Auto: The wireless access point will automatically determine the wireless channel width.
WirelessChannelWidth.Standard: The wireless channel is 20 MHz wide.
WirelessChannelWidth.Wide: The wireless channel is 40 MHz wide.
WirelessChannelWidth.Wide80: The wireless channel is 80 MHz wide.

WirelessSecurity.None: No authentication or encryption; commonly referred to as "open".
WirelessSecurity.WEP: WEP protocol with no authentication and WEP encryption using a preshared key; commonly referred to as "WEP shared".
WirelessSecurity.WPA-Personal: WPA protocol with preshared-key authentication and TKIP encryption.
WirelessSecurity.WPA-Enterprise: WPA protocol with RADIUS authentication and TKIP encryption.
WirelessSecurity.WPA2-Personal: WPA2 protocol with preshared-key authentication and AES encryption.
WirelessSecurity.WPA2-Enterprise: WPA2 protocol with RADIUS authentication and AES encryption.

BandSteeringMode.Basic: Basic band steering mode between two 5GHz radios.
BandSteeringMode.Advanced: Advanced band steering mode across all three radios.

WEPEncryption.WEP-64: 64-bit WEP encryption with a 40-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.
WEPEncryption.WEP-128: 128-bit WEP encryption with a 104-bit key. This value should only be used when the security type is WEP.
